summary: This document is an email chain from September 25, 2019, among FBI and DOJ personnel coordinating logistics for victim briefings related to the Epstein case. The briefings are scheduled for October 15, 2019, in Miramar, Florida, and October 23, 2019, in New York City, to inform victims about available services.

persons.name: Mandy
persons.context: Mentioned as being present with the sender while discussing the briefing logistics.

persons.name: Sosa
persons.context: Referenced in relation to a conference room reservation made for the Epstein briefing in Miami.

persons.name: Joe N.
persons.context: Listed as a recipient on the email chain discussing briefing arrangements.

persons.name: Flood, H.
persons.context: Appears as a recipient on the forwarded email regarding the Epstein briefings confirmation.

connections.description: Both are involved in FBI Victim Services Division activities related to organizing the Epstein victim briefings.

events.title: Epstein Victim Briefing - Florida
events.description: Scheduled victim briefing at 2030 SW 145th Avenue, Miramar, FL 33027, at 10:00 AM for victims of the Epstein case to learn about available services.

events.title: Epstein Victim Briefing - New York
events.description: Scheduled victim briefing at 290 Broadway, New York, NY 10007, at 10:00 AM for victims of the Epstein case to learn about available services.

events.title: Coordination of Epstein Briefings
events.description: Email chain among FBI and DOJ personnel confirming and coordinating logistics for victim briefings in Miami and New York.

keyFacts: The FBI Victim Services Division confirmed victim briefings for the Epstein case in both Miami and New York in October 2019.
Briefings were scheduled for October 15, 2019, in Miramar, Florida, and October 23, 2019, in New York City.
The briefings aimed to inform victims about available services but would not provide specific details about the active investigation.
Victims were allowed to bring one support person and needed to RSVP by October 4, 2019.
Coordination involved multiple FBI and DOJ personnel, including the FBI NY Field Office and the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York.
